page.title: 19ECOLOGY FERNDOWN HEATH
page.content: On the{heath}beside our school, I have looked under rocks and stones and found{slowworms.}The male has a black line along its back but both male and female have a variety of patterns. Mature worms are about 30 cm long and babies about 10 cm. They are born singly. Slowworms feed morning and evening on earthworms, small slugs and other insects. They are sometimes mistaken for snakes but are actually a type of lizard. Their enemies are cats, dogs, birds and MAN. They are able to grow another tail if necessary. There are two{ponds}on the heath. We visit them as part of our Science work and see many kinds of pond life. If we take any animals out of the pond to look at them through a magnifying glass, we must remember to put them back without harming them.
